question: 恋愛
partsOfSpeech: noun, する verb, の adjective
sourceMnemonic: When you have <kanji>romance</kanji> and <kanji>love</kanji> all in the same package. Well, that is <vocabulary>love</vocabulary>! Ah, love! This is the word used when talking about love, though. You don't use this to say "I love you."
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
